name: Staybridge Suites--Wilmington/Newark

reviews.text: This is a standard Staybridge Suites, and a result, quite comfortable for a business stay. I checked in early and the front desk manager personally visited a room that had just been cleaned to confirm that it was ready. I stayed in a studio, which is more spacious than typical hotel rooms, with a small kitchenette, a sitting area, and a bathroom alcove. The bed seemed new and was great. The only two minor negatives I observed were thin walls, as I clearly heard the next door tv at medium volume, and the fact that the hotel is physically connected and adjacent to a lower quality Ramada Inn, sharing one pool. However, I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Comfortable Stay

reviews.text: We just spent 10 days there and the combination of price and amenities can't be beat. Ashleigh at the front desk and the weekday morning woman at the breakfast bar are the type of people you wished were at every hotel
reviews.title: Great accommodations

reviews.text: Was in a room by elevator. Worried about noise. Able to shut bedroom door, no noise, slept great. Low fat yogurt and skim milk on free breakfast buffet. Toiletries & snacks available. Easy to get to and near work locations. Very nice employees at front desk. Easy free parking.
reviews.title: Good night's sleep in a conveniently located hotel.

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for a long term business assignment. They treated me like a king. Very comfortable and convenient. Free, excellent breakfast vailable every day. Free laundry available. All under the same roof. I would go there again without hesitation.
reviews.title: Staybridge Suites Newark is 1st Rate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very reluctant to try this hotel because it was part of the Holiday Inn chain and we had some bad experiences with Holiday Inn hotels, however we were very glad that we did. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms very clean. The only slight negative was the breakfast which had a few unidenitifiable hot dishes, but at least there was a waffle iron.
reviews.title: Haven from the storm

reviews.text: For my business trip and stay which lasted two months, this was a great place to set up camp.
reviews.title: Convience and Accomodating

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was served at an hour that a working person can enjoy and still be on the job early. Evening social hour also served its purpose.
reviews.title: 9th wonder of the world

reviews.text: Rooms were clean, and the staff did the extra things to make me feel at home, as much as could be under the circumstances.
reviews.title: Over booked our reservation and relocated us at the Days Inn in Wilmington, Del

reviews.text: Business functions could be carried out with no issues.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It worked for me.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: We are Priority Club members and had reserved a two bedroom suite about a month in advance. When we arrived there were apparently no two bedroom suites available. The young woman at the front desk, who was very apologetic, told us that there were a number of families staying there long-term, thus the room shortage. The hotel should coordinate its online reservations to reflect this type of problem. Meanwhile, we were accommodated in two separate suites, which worked out fine, and were compensated for our trouble by a much lower room rate.
reviews.title: Good, but not perfect.

reviews.text: The rooms were quite clean and the beds were very comfortable. The breakfast was what we've become accustomed to at this type of hotel, and it was well presented and fresh.
reviews.title: Nice spot to Relax

reviews.text: If I were to stay here again, I would be sure to call close to arrival to be sure I would receive the proper room
reviews.title: It was truely a Blessing to my family.

reviews.text: This is a nice place to shop with so many places to choose from.So many restaurants ....just awesome location. The staff there were pleasant and polite.
reviews.title: Nice & Convenient

reviews.text: They were so helpful it you needed anything!
reviews.title: average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really nice hotel except that entrance was hard to find with its proximity to Ramada.You guys need a sign so people bypass Ramada and experience your great hotel. Upon arriving we were greeted with smiles n friendly attitude by Ashley P. which meant a lot since we were on the road for hours. When we left we accidentally left our GPS device in the room and phoned various times for someone to check the room. Ashley was the only one who took the initiative to personally locate it since it had already been removed from the room. We cant tell you how much we appreciated her "Over n above work attitude" n honesty to get the GPS returned to us. She is the type of employee you really need to appreciate since customers will always return.
reviews.title: Good Hotel n fantastic employee Ashley P

reviews.text: As someone who spends many nights in hotels, this one was particularly clean and well-maintained. There was even a BBQ dinner w/ wine and beer. Staff, especially the assistant general manager, was very friendly and professional. When I missed breakfast, she offered to go into the kitchen to get me a banana and muffin. When I thought I had left a bracelet, she immediately went to check out my vacated room. Just when you think service is dead, someone surprises you! Hotel is definitely a good find in this area.
reviews.title: Clean, well-maintained, great service

reviews.text: I stayed here for a night while on travel for business and was very impressed. The room was huge! They also provided a very nice dinner when I checked in which was nice becasue it was snowing and I didn't want to have to drive anymore. The breakfast was really fantastic too!
reviews.title: Huge Rooms!

reviews.text: I made a reservation here for my family as we were driving home from Virginia Beach to avoid Hurricane Irene -- although I had never stayed at a Staybridge Suites, I picked it because it had the two-room suite for a great price, and the free breakfast. There were several other suite hotels nearby so I took a chance on the unfamiliar.
reviews.title: GREAT place for families, glad we found it!

reviews.text: I stayed there with my husband, two kids and my parents so there were six of us altogether. We arrived fairly late at night and were anxious to get settled in for the night. My first impression was that the decor was beautiful in the lobby/dining area. I continued to be impressed when we got to our room. The "living room" had more than enough space for the fold-out couch when it was opened, leaving enough room to walk around it (a problem we had encountered more than once at other suite hotels), and both of the bedrooms were spacious as well. Everything was perfectly clean and neat and looked new.
reviews.title: Service goes above and beyond

description: At the Staybridge Suites Wilmington Newark Hotel, in Wilmington Newark DE, we strive to make every guest feel welcome & comfortable! Located directly off of I-95 & State Highway 273, our Wilmington Newark Hotel in Wilmington Newark DE is conveniently accessible. With Free High Speed Internet Access & 24-hour business center, Hot Breakfast Buffet, Free Laundry Services, Evening Receptions, & Exercise Room set the Staybridge Suites Wilmington Newark, in Wilmington Newark DE apart from other area hotel options. Select the Staybridge Suites Wilmington Newark, in Wilmington Newark DE for accommodations when visiting Astra Zeneca, Du Pont, Christiana Hospital, or several other area corporations. For shoppers, we are less than 3 miles from Christiana Mall, and for those craving excitement, we are just 5 miles from Delaware Park Racetrack & Slots. Choose Staybridge Suites Wilmington Newark DE Hotel for your needs when attending events at the University of Delaware, Wilmington College, or Delaware State University. Whether you need lodging for a mid-week business trip, weekend fun, or relocation, remember the Staybridge Suites Wilmington Newark Hotel in Wilmington Newark DE.
